intro: Adenostachya, commonly known as the "arrowhead grass," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the grass family, Poaceae. These plants are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in moist or wetland habitats. Adenostachya species are characterized by their distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and clustered inflorescences. They are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in waterlogged soils. Some species are also utilized in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
